conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true isometric/cutaway 3D model: walls have clear height and thickness, multiple faces are visible, rooms read as volumetric spaces, and the roof/ceiling is removed to expose the interior.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Strong 3D extrusion with readable corners and wall thickness; elevated/isometric view with minimal distortion; clean cutaway. Minor deductions for simplified/rounded interior opening geometry that slightly departs from typical planar wall/door detailing.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall layout matches the 2D plan well (dining left, kitchen top-center, entrance top-right into living, bedroom bottom-left, bath core center-bottom, stair zone bottom-right). Some discrepancies: wash/toilet separation looks simplified/merged and several door openings appear stylized (arched) rather than matching exact 2D door placement/swing; window placements appear generally consistent but not verifiable as exact per wall segment.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture and fixtures present: dining table/chairs, kitchen counters/sink, living sofa set, bed, toilet/sink. Placement corresponds to intended rooms; slight simplification of bathroom program (wash area vs toilet) and generic kitchen/bath detailing.

visual_clarity.notes: Clear separation of floors/walls/openings; lighting and materials make the interior readable; no major mesh artifacts. Presentation is clean with neutral background.

detected_errors.description: Service core (wash area/toilet) appears simplified compared to the 2D plan’s partitioning, reducing fidelity of internal subdivision.
Several interior openings/doors appear stylized (arched) and may not match exact door positions/swing details from the 2D plan; window exactness cannot be confirmed for every segment.

summary: A genuine and clean 3D cutaway conversion with strong overall plan fidelity, with minor-to-moderate deviations in door/opening treatment and bathroom sub-partition accuracy.
